---
title: "Chocolate Chip Cookies"
format: html
---

## Ingredients

| Dry ingredient | Amount (single batch) | Amount (double batch) |
| --- | --- | --- | 
| Flour | 160 grams | 320 grams |
| Salt | ½ teaspoon | 1 teaspoon |
| Baking soda | ½ teaspoon | 1 teaspoon |
| Cinnamon (optional) | ¼ teaspoon | ½ teaspoon | 

| Wet ingredient | Amount (single batch) | Amount (double batch) |
| --- | --- | --- | 
| Butter | 114 grams | 228 grams |
| White sugar | 100 grams | 200 grams |
| Brown sugar |110 grams | 220 grams |
| Egg | 1 | 2 |
| Vanilla extract | 1 teaspoon | 2 teaspoons |

| Mix-ins | Amount (single batch) | Amount (double batch) |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Chocolate chips | 175 grams | 350 grams |

## Directions

1. Start by browning the butter. Then let the browned butter cool down to room temperature.

2. In a bowl mix the browned butter, brown sugar, and white sugar to create the batter.

3. Add the egg at room temperature to the batter and continue mixing.

4. Add the vanilla, salt and baking soda and mix thoroughly before adding the flour and the chocolate chips.

5. If baking from
    - Fresh, 350 for about 10 minutes 
    - Frozen 335-340 for about 17 minutes
